name: Alcohol Stove
description: Install Origo Stove

name: Electrical Panel with Breakers
description: Rewire electrical panel with breakers instead of fuses.

name: Sell Spinnakers
description: Put spinnakers on craigslist or email minnies

name: Clean the Bilge
description: Clear all the water and scrub the alge out

name: Steaming Lamp
description: Reinstall the steaming lamp on the mast, including running wiring inside the mast

name: Anchor Lamp
description: Inspect anchor lamp when mast comes down

name: Bolt Down Pulpits and Stanchions
description: Check and replace missing bolts on pulpits and stanchions

name: Foresail Deck Back
description: Design and fabricate a bag to protect the foresail without pulling it off the forestay

name: Stove Fuel Tank
description: Buy and install a 5 gallon fuel tank near the stove
notes: Now have a 5 gallon jerry can for this purpose.

name: Transmission Cable
description: Remove existing transmission cable, measure it, order a new one, and install it
notes: Need to cut out port icebox to access transmission cable

name: Windows
description: Fabricate new portlights out of acrylic and install them (7 windows)

name: Paint Bottom
description: Sand, prep and paint the hull

name: Eybolts on Cockpit
description: Install eyebolts so tiller can be lashed for vane steering

name: Service Winches
description: Take apart the winches and grease them

name: V-Berth Hatch
description: V-Berth hatch is quite leaky and needs to be resealed

name: Kayak
description: Fix up the kayak at Josh's, if it's still there, or buy another

name: Alternator Diode
description: Install alternator diode so batteries can be hooked up to charge

name: Shroud Chainplate
description: Fill voids with epoxy when sealing deck

name: Stanchion Backplates
description: Glass in plywood backplates and re-bed all lifeline stanchions.

name: Lifelines
description: Replace the old rusted lifelines

name: Choke Cable
description: Install a new choke cable

name: Main Halyard
description: Buy and install a new halyard that's long enough to be run to the cockpit

name: Standing Rigging
description: Measure, buy and install new standing rigging to replace old rod rigging

name: Salon Hatch
description: Reverse the hatch over the salon so that the boom vang can be installed

name: Fuel Water Separator
description: Hook up the fuel-water seperator so the carb doesn't get clogged

name: Gas Pump Starter Bypass
description: Install a relay to activate gas pump when starter is cranking

name: Bow Cleat
description: Glass in plywood backing plate for bow cleat

name: Boom Vang
description: Contact manufacturer to get different mast end, then install it

name: Bilge Topside Drainage
description: Route auto bilge pump output into output side of manual pump so it goes overboard

name: Head sink drainage
description: Remove head sink (so it stops filling with water) and cover the hole left with plywood.

name: Bilge Hatch
description: Create and install new bilge hatch, perhaps matching with even floor nearby

name: Stern Chainlocker
description: Build and install a chainlocker aft of the tiller for the stern anchor

name: Bow Chainlocker
description: Install plywood and/or heavy webbing so that chain in the bow locker doesn't trash the hull
notes: Alternatively, in the longer term, install two chainlockers toward the sides of the hull just in front of thethe door to the v-berth.

name: Gas Tank
description: Buy and install a new 12-gallon gas tank with fittings

name: Inspect Old Gas Tank
description: Pull out, empty and inspect existing gas tank to determine if it's fit for continued service

name: Port Deck
description: Remove port headliner under deck, pull up all port deck fittings, drill holes to check for core rot, dry any wet core, tape up holes, fill with expoxy, reattach deck hardware

name: Jacklines
description: Install jacklines on both sides of the cabin, from bow to stern

name: Salon Lighting
description: Install LED lighting above salon table

name: Stern Cleats
description: Install the stern cleats that came with the boat on the stern

name: Oil Pressure Ignition Cutoff
description: Install a relay attached to the oil presure cuttof switch that will cut off ignition power in addition to fuel pump power if oil pressure cuts out. Must have timer for starting grace period.

name: Mirror in Head
description: Install a stainless steel mirror in the head

name: Curtains
description: Get snaps and install curtains

name: Knotmeter Impeller
description: Buy and install impeller for knotmeter

name: Dive Setup
description: Get oxygen tank recertified and buy mask and regulator

name: LED Masthead Light
description: Buy and instal an LED bulb in the masthead light

name: Rain Catch System
description: Devise and set up a system for catching and potentially filtering rainwater

name: Freshwater Engine Cooling
description: Buy and install freshwater cooling kit for A4

name: Mast Collar
description: Get the correct bolts for the mast collar, so they don't spin loose or rust

name: Third Reef In Mainsail
description: Contact North Sails and have them install a third reef in the main

name: Gennaker
description: Buy a gennaker for light weather downwind sailing

name: Propane Stove System
description: Buy and install transom-mounted propane tanks, a regulator, solenoid, line, and stove.
notes: Mostly just a theoretical cost calculation

name: Cruising Anchor Gear
description: Buy and install a windlass and 250' of chain.

name: Compasses
description: Buy and install compass domes, LED lights, and compass fluid.

name: Window Trim
description: Once new windows are installed, salvage/buy new/used hardwood trim for interior and exterior
notes: 380" total circumfrence for non-opening windows  * 2 ~= 64' of something like 3/4" x 2" (actual) lumber.

name: Engine Exhaust
description: Pull the exhaust manifold, clean it out, extract black iron pipe leading to standpipe. Clean up standpipe, evaluate need to disassemble and reassemble with new copper jacket. Rebuild hot section with new pipe and stainless flex hose, paint, and wrap.

name: Install Fiddles and Tiedowns
description: Install fiddles and/or tiedowns for stuff inside the boat so it doesn't go flying at sea.

name: Finished Yuloh
description: Finish the yuloh with the spinnaker pole as a loom.

name: Solar Electric Setup
description: Solar panels, charger and battery banks
notes: Still need to calculate mounting options
